column4: is there a way to test my fileserver's speed on the LAN Network ?
there is a benchmark for ethernet connection..
iperf, I think it's called.. but it won't benchmark your file server.. just the connection
what do you mean by "stop" ? you can ask it to quit nicely
well, throug init.d it doesn't work
doesn't work? do you get some kind of error message?
but when I ps aux it's clearly running
so no need to stop it
that stop command doesn't just kill every process with a certain name.. it kills the process it started earlier.. so if you've run the vsftp program yourself it won't kill it for you.. afaik
but try killing that stray vsftp process using kill, pkill or whatever method you like..
hum okay, but init.d won't kill processed it started himself
it starts a process and saves the pID in a file.. when you stop it it kills the process with the pID from the file.. if I understand things correctly
so if you start vsftp by running it from a terminal you can't kill it using init.d
.... oh damn I see what happened!
yeah it reminds me of when I used Windows :(
